Why do I love mikuni mizuki's works so much? Because whenever he wrotes his hentai it will probably be the most dramatic hentai you'll ever read. I've always had this weird fascination with fucked up relationships that turns into something wholesome. And oh boy does mizuki-sensei does those to different kinds of level. The manga that he made which was about a girl cheating because of the girl's live-in partner being so ignorant (though I'm not a fan of it) I genuinely think it was a good story. and The manga encounter was great. Wicked woman is probably a personal favorite of mine. Along with natsu to kaito. But the way mizuki mikuni flows his narratives to a very well written wholesome manga is just perfect. And the trope we've seen before countless of times where the sister is more superior so the other is jealous is so overused and so redundant but for some reason mizuki-sensei inserts some hentai magic and mizuki magic to make it a perfect 10/10 manga. I love this work

@w079 Technically speaking, it does exist - in Ancient Greece, there are words that describe various types of love. In terms of romantic love, it can be due to a lack of trust/faith, improper communication, or just simply that the person isn't "the one". Don't get me wrong - I am just as much of a believer in romanticism (though not as much as a lot of people who like vanilla and denounce non-vanilla stuff) as the next person. Does true love actually exist? Maybe. Perhaps away from appearing on the internet.
